title: Add SKMask & basic Blitting support
body:
## Add SKMask and Blitting Support
This PR requires https://github.com/mono/skia/pull/39.

Details about this PR can be found @ https://github.com/mono/skia/pull/39.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Is there a reason that you used a class SkMask instead of a struct? Typically we want to keep structs structs and classes classes.

Also, what exactly is the blitter being used for in this case? the blitters are "internal"-ish (they have no SK_API and they live under the src folder instead of the public headers/include folder). Even though you may have a 1 bpp bitmap, you are still using a 1 byte mask and blitter. How is this better/different than using a `SKColorType.Gray8` image? that is also a 1 byte per pixel image.

Am I correct in my understanding that this was to be able to load a nice color image. and then after loading the mask, apply the mast to the bitmap, turning that bitmap into a transparent bitmap?

comments.author: Tylerflick
comments.body:
> Is there a reason that you used a class SkMask instead of a struct? Typically we want to keep structs structs and classes classes.

Makes sense. I'll fix that.

> Even though you may have a 1 bpp bitmap, you are still using a 1 byte mask and blitter.

This is not true with the SkMask struct or stencil masks in general. In Skia a raw byte array is loaded into the mask. This avoids inflating 1bpp masks 8 fold.

>  How is this better/different than using a SKColorType.Gray8 image?

For blended/soft masks it's not. In fact for most blended masks the default color space of the mask is 
Gray8.

I'm not really sure why Skia is exposing a 32-bit, 16-bit, etc. mask type. I'm still doing a bit of work on this and haven't updated that branch in a bit.
